channel.title: Global Triathlon Network
channel.description:
We've all seen Front Crawl in practice, but how do you actually do it for real? We've got a freestyle swimming technique masterclass for you to learn and master yourself! Don't forget to 'like' and subscribe to see more content like this from us üôå
Subscribe to GTN: http://gtn.io/SubscribetoGTN Check out the GTN Shop: https://gtn.io/rJ
If you enjoyed this video, make sure to give it a thumbs up and share it with your friends. üëç
Submit your content here: https://upload.globaltrinetwork.com/

The Global Triathlon Network (GTN) is the best triathlon YouTube channel, with videos for anyone who loves triathlon: from seasoned Ironman racers to first-timers ‚Äì and everyone in between.
With the help of our pro and Olympic medal winning team, we‚Äôre here to inform, entertain and inspire you to become a better triathlete; including videos on:
How to swim, bike, and run faster with expert knowledge Beat your PB with record-breaking expertise Get the best from your bike and gear with pro-know-how In-depth, entertaining features from the heart of the sport Chat, opinion and interact with us across the channel and on social media every week
Join us on YouTube‚Äôs best triathlon channel to get closer to the sport and to become a better, faster and fitter triathlete.
Welcome to the Global Triathlon Network.

item.description:
This week's Coach's Corner is all about heart rate zones. How do I stop tipping into zone 3? Should I be finding zone 2 so uncomfortable? Why does my watch say zone 4 when I'm running slowly? We end today's #gtncoachescorner with a round of quickfire questions so we can answer as many of your queries on heart rate as possible! üôå
0:00 - Intro 0:30 - I keep tipping into zone 3 2:18 - I find zone 2 uncomfortable 3:55 - Heart rate too high when running 5:38 - Should I run indoors more? 8:28 - Try to run Z2 but my watch says Z4 10:06 - My Z2 HR for MaxHR and LTHR are very different 11:16 - I can't have both high cadence and high pace 12:37 - Why is my watch saying I swim at max HR?
Useful Links Submit your Photo and Video to us üëâ https://gtn.io/UPLOAD Check out the GTN Shop üëâ https://gtn.io/TeamKit GTN Training Plans üëâ gcn.eu/gtntp
Sticking to zone 2 during your training can be a real challenge, do you have any tips or advice for staying within the heart rate zone? ‚ù§Ô∏è Share it with the community in the comment section below! üí¨
Watch more on GTN... üìπ Why Is Everyone Talking About Zone 2?! üëâ https://youtu.be/tqTYJg2mnT0 üìπ Watch our Editor‚Äôs Choice Playlist üëâ https://gtn.io/editorschoice üìπ Watch our weekly show, The GTN Show üëâ https://gtn.io/GTNshowPlaylist

item.description:
Some carbon shoe questions at WTCS Abu Dhabi, a shortened swim at Ironman South Africa, & a controversial DQ for that matter! Mark rounds up the latest race, tech news, and stories from the world of triathlon. Oh & a runner that has been completing races with a fridge on his back!

item.description:
Every lap pool that has ever been swum has been labelled as either a ‚Äòfast pool‚Äô or a ‚Äòslow pool‚Äô! Mostly this is subjective and any swimming pool‚Äôs design is up for debate squad. But there are factors that affect how fast you swim in a pool, & when you are swimming many hundreds of laps those factors add up! So let‚Äôs look at the reasons your pool could be slow!

item.description:

item.description:
When you look at pro triathletes Jan Frodeno & Chrissie Wellington, you may think that they have THE perfect body type for triathlon. But what is the perfect body type? Does it really even exist? With three different sports to think about, Heather shares with us how our bodies can help our performance in different ways and answers the question: Is there a perfect body type for a triathlon?
0:00 - Intro 1:35 - Body shapes of individual sports 2:10 - The perfect triathlon body shape? 2:58 - Higher ectomorphy 3:57 - Maximise your strengths 4:30 - Age groupers 4:56 - Weight and performance 6:10 - Is there a perfect body shape?

Is there a pro that you think has the perfect body type for triathlon? Let us know in the comment section below! üí¨

- How to swim, bike, and run faster with expert knowledge - Try our session ideas - Investigations into wide-ranging topics - The best triathlon bike tech and gear with pro-know-how - In-depth, entertaining features from the heart of the sport - Chat, opinion and interact with us across the channel and on social media!
Join us on YouTube‚Äôs best triathlon channel to get closer to the sport and to become a better, faster and fitter triathlete!
Welcome to the Global Triathlon Network.

item.title: Why Does My Swimming Leg Kick Suck?
item.author: Global Triathlon Network

item.description:
What if we told you that the secret to your sporting success was to do nothing? To stop waking up early for that extra training session and instead, get in some quality üí§. In this video, James and Mark explain why getting a good amount of sleep might actually make you faster! üò¥
0:00 - Intro 0:22 - Three pillars of athletic performance 1:34 - Affects of lack of sleep 2:10 - Benefits of sleep 3:23 - What is good sleep? 4:26 - Can you catch up with naps 5:35 - Do I need as much when I'm injured 6:10 - Tips to sleep better

How much sleep do you get? Let us know in the comment section below! üí¨
